meanings.definition: A shallow recess, especially one in a wall to display a statue or other ornament.
meanings.sent1: The small niche in the wall held a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: She placed the figurine in the niche by the window.
meanings.sent3: The niche in the garden wall was so tiny, only a tiny gnome could fit.
meanings.sent4: Her love for art found a home in the niche of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The niche in the classroom showcased student artwork.

meanings.definition: A comfortable or suitable position in life or employment.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, she finally found her niche in the company.
meanings.sent2: He felt like he belonged, like he had found his niche in the world.
meanings.sent3: She discovered her niche in baking, creating delicious treats for all.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean of careers, she found her niche as a teacher.
meanings.sent5: His niche in the family was the one who always made everyone laugh.
